alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 10:43AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1249 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 1249 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain continuing. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, San Diego, Moreno Valley, Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, El Cajon, Vista, Redlands, Encinitas and National City. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
